overview:
Patrick Rousseau is the co-founder of budtobud, a social music experience created around friends playing music for each other. Imagine friends listening to music together – whether in Manhattan, Milan or Melbourne – while they chat, rate each other’s music, buy content, review listening histories, and share their experiences on Facebook and Twitter.

He has previously co-founded Blackline GPS. He has lead the company and seeded it with a portfolio of products that is used around the globe. BlackLine was the first company in big box retail with a tracking device and is still a leader in the market. Blackline is listed on the TSX.V.

Patrick and his work has been featured on CNBC, G4TV, Engadget, Car and Driver, Palyboy, Sail Magazine, Wired, Laptop Magazine, Alberta Venture, Calgary Inc.
